alert.note: Alert for Barnes; Cass (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 22 at 6:08PM CST until February 23 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Dangerous wind chills as low as 40 below zero. * WHERE...In Minnesota, Clay County. In North Dakota, Barnes and Cass Counties. * WHEN...From 6 PM this evening to noon CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning commute. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero will cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Dangerously cold wind chills combined with blizzard conditions will make travel life-threatening to those stranded.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at dot.nd.gov/travel and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.
